intro: Monanthotaxis boivinii var. boivinii, commonly known as the Boivin's monanthotaxis, is a rare and striking member of the Araliaceae family. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Madagascar, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with a velvety texture and deep green coloration. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are typically white or pale yellow, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
